children.name: do business
children.definition: /ˌduː ˈbɪzns/  if a company does business with another company, it buys things from them or sells things to them:
examples: ▪ i hope you’ll think about my offer. i’m sure we can do business.
do business with
▪ they do a lot of business with italian companies.
▪ she’s very efficient - the kind of person you want to do business with.
do good businessdo a lot of successful business
▪ they’ve been doing very good business lately. they’ll probably even expand their operations.

children.name: be in business
children.definition: /biː ɪn ˈbɪzns/  if someone is in business they own a company or shop:
examples: ▪ in all the twenty years i’ve been in business this is the worst period i’ve seen for sales.
▪ the insurance companies are in business to make money, not waste it.
set up in businessbritish start a company, shop etc
▪ when i qualified i set up in business as a financial consultant.

children.name: deal with x
children.definition: deal with/ˈdiːl wɪð/  to buy goods from another company or person, or sell goods to them:
examples: ▪ i deal with farmers, selling them things like cattle feed and insecticides.
▪ they don’t buy their office supplies from a store - they only deal with the manufacturers.
▪ we don’t deal with the actors directly - we usually have to go through their agents.
dealverb[ i or t ]dealt,dealtdo business
to do business
_we only dealwithcompanies which have a good credit record.
_slanghow long had she been dealing (= selling drugs) before she was arrested?
_slanghe was suspected of dealing (= selling) cocaine.

children.name: deal in x
children.definition: deal in/ˈdiːl ɪn something/  to do business buying or selling a particular product:
examples: kinh doanh mặt hàng gì
▪ companies that deal in oil should prepare themselves for a price drop.
▪ the main commodities he dealt in were rice, and lentils.

children.name: trade b2
children.definition: trade/treɪd/  if a country or large organization trades with another country or large organization, they buy, sell, or exchange goods with each other:
examples: trade with
▪ the two nations have not traded with each other for over 30 years.
trading partnera country that regularly does business with another country
▪ japan is one of our major trading partners.
tradeverbbuy and sell buôn bán, kinh doanh, trao đổi mậu dịch
[ i or t usually + adverb or preposition ]to buy and sell goods or services, especiallybetween countries
_for centuries, native americans tradedwitheuropean settlers.
_the company has been tradinginoil for many years.
_the two countries have become close tradingpartners.
_our books are traded right acrossasia.

children.name: operate b2
children.definition: operate/ˈɒpəreɪtǁˈɑː-/  if a company or organization operates it takes part in business activities, especially in one country or in one kind of business:
examples: (công ty, tổ chức) hoạt động ( trong 1 khu vực, lĩnh vực nào đó )
▪ olivetti operates in all the major computer markets in the world.
▪ screenview are a small company operating from a converted barn in a village near norwich.

children.name: private b2
children.definition: private/ˈpraɪvɪt, ˈpraɪvət/  a private school, hospital etc is not one that is owned by the government and that you must pay money to use:
examples: tư nhân
▪ private hospitals can afford to pay much higher salaries than state-run hospitals.
▪ the government plans to sell part of the railway network to private investors.
▪ do you think the teaching in private schools is better than in state schools?
privately[adverb]
tư nhân
▪ privately educated at a private school
▪ journalists flew in on a privately chartered plane.
privateadjectivenot official tư
controlled or paid for by a person or company and not by the government
_private education/healthcare
_a private doctor/dentist
_banks should be supporting small private businesses.

children.name: commercial c2
children.definition: commercial/kəˈmɜːʳʃəl/
examples: thương mại ( nói về truyền thông ko thuộc nhà nước và kinh doanh vì lợi ích thương mại )
commercial tv/radio/channela television or radio company that gets its money from advertising:
tv/radio/kênh thương mại
▪ most european countries have a mixture of commercial and state-run television.
▪ denmark’s first commercial channel went on air on june 1, 1987.
▪ the most popular commercial radio station in london

children.name: independent b2
children.definition: independent/ˌɪndɪˈpendənt◂, ˌɪndəˈpendənt◂/  not owned or paid for by the government:
examples: độc lập ( nói về tổ chức ko thuộc nhà nước )
▪ robin worked for one of the largest independent television companies.
▪ local companies and industries have been helping independent schools by providing buildings and equipment.

children.name: private /free enterprise u
children.definition: private enterprise/free enterprise/ˌpraɪvɪt ˈentəʳpraɪz, ˌpraɪvət ˈentəʳpraɪz, ˌfriː ˈentəʳpraɪz/  the economicsystemin which industries, factories etc are owned and controlled by private companies and not by the government :
examples: các hoạt động kinh doanh tư nhân
▪ sweden has always had a mixture of private enterprise and state control in its economy.
▪ margaret thatcher tried to encourage private enterprise by selling off britain’s nationalized industries.
▪ even in the united states, free enterprise is subject to government controls.
private enterprisenoun[ u ] xí nghiệp tư nhân
industry and businesses owned by ordinary people, not by the government

children.name: mercantile x
children.definition: mercantileadjectiveformal
examples: kinh doanh thương mại
related to trade or business

children.name: business b1
children.definition: business/ˈbɪznɪs, ˈbɪznəs/
examples: ▪ during the first week of the secretarial course we learned how to write business letters.
▪ most of the women there were wearing business suits.
business trip/lunch/meetinga trip, meal etc arranged for business reasons not pleasure
▪ he’s in tokyo on a business trip.
business associatesomeone you do business with
▪ i’ve known mr henry for years. he’s one of my father’s old business associates.

children.name: commercial b2
children.definition: commercial/kəˈmɜːʳʃəl/  a commercial activity or organization is concerned with the business of buying and selling goods and services:
examples: ▪ his first commercial venture was opening a small corner shop.
▪ the british empire was established for commercial as well as political reasons.
▪ the space shuttle is being used more and more for commercial purposes.
commercially[adverb] relating to whether something is successful and makes a profit::
▪ commercially, the movie was a disaster.
commercialadjective thuộc về hoặc dành cho thương mại
related to buying and selling things
_a commercial organization/venture/success
_commercial law
_the commercial future of the company looks very promising.

children.name: to make a public company or organization private
privatize c1
children.definition: privatize/ˈpraɪvɪtaɪz, ˈpraɪvətaɪz/  if a government privatizes a government-controlled industry, service, or company, it sells it to private owners, who then manage it for their own profit:
examples: tư hữu hóa
▪ hungary has been very keen to privatize its major industries, following the democratic reforms of 1988.
▪ employees of the strathtay bus company, which has been privatized, are concerned that drivers are about to be made redundant.
privatized[adjective]bịtư hữu hóa
▪ the government plans to introduce a privatized health system.
privatization/ˌpraɪvɪtaɪˈzeɪʃən, ˌpraɪvətaɪˈzeɪʃənǁ-tə-/ [uncountable noun]sựtư hữu hóa
▪ the recent privatization of bus services has led to escalating prices.
privatize,uk usuallyprivatiseverb[ t ]tư hữu hoá, tư nhân hoá
if a government privatizes an industry, company or service that it owns and controls, itsells it so that it becomes privately owned and controlled
_i bought shares in british gas when it was privatized.

children.name: deal b2
children.definition: deal/diːl/  a business agreement between two companies, especially when one company agrees to provide goods or services, and another company agrees to buy them :
examples: ▪ wickes lost a lot of money on two large property deals.
deal with
▪ they agreed a $55 million deal with a leading japanese automobile company.
sign a deal
▪ taylor recently signed a deal to lease her three-bedroom home for $14,000.
finalize a dealcomplete it
▪ it is expected that the deal will be finalized before the end of may.
dealnounagreement (sự) thoả thuận (nhất là trong kinh doanh)
[ c ] an agreement or an arrangement, especially in business
_a business deal
_the unions and management havemadea two-year pay and productivity deal.
_i'llmake/doa dealwithyou - you wash the car and i'll let you use it tonight.
_she gota gooddeal (= paid a low price)onher new house.
_is industrygettingaraw/roughdeal from (= being unfairly/badly treated by) the eu?

children.name: contract c2
children.definition: contractverbagreement hợp đồng; giao kèo; khế ước
examples: [ i or t ] to make a legal agreement with someone to do work or to have work done for you
_[ + to infinitive ]they have just contracted our
companytobuild shelters for the homeless.

children.name: business a1
children.definition: business/ˈbɪznɪs, ˈbɪznəs/  the work that companies do when they buy and sell goods and services:
examples: ▪ business in europe has been badly affected by economic conditions in asia.
on businessfor business reasons
▪ she’ll be back next week - she’s in korea on business.
the advertising/computer/insurance businessthe work of companies that are involved in advertising, computers etc
▪ he’s been in the advertising business for over 20 years now, and he wants to get out.
have a head for businesshave a good understanding of business
▪ spending a year working for a big company will be good for him - at the moment he has no head for business at all.
businessnounselling việc buôn bán; việc kinh doanh; việc thương mại
[ c or u ] the activity of buying and selling goods and services, or a particular company that does this, or work you do to earn money
_my brother'sinbusiness.
_he'sin thefrozen food business.
_the two brothers established/set up/started up a clothes retailing business.
_our firmdoesa lot of businesswithoverseas customers.
_eventually they found a consultant they felt they coulddobusinesswith(= with whom they could work well) .
_currently, there are fewer firmsinbusiness (= operating) in the area than ever before.
_this new tax will put a lot of small firmsout ofbusiness (= they will stop operating) .
_sheset up inbusiness (= started her own company) as a management consultant.
_how is business (= are you selling much) at the moment?
_business is good/brisk/booming/flourishing (= i'm selling a lot) .
_business is bad/slack/quiet (= i'm not selling much) .
_i'm inbaltimoreonbusiness.
_a business appointment

children.name: trade b1
children.definition: trade/treɪd/  the buying and selling of goods and services, especially between countries:
examples: trade with/between
▪ the introduction of the euro should make trade between european countries much easier.
trade in somethingthe buying and selling of a particular kind of goods
▪ the trade in data processing between countries is likely to grow faster than the trade in goods.
trade agreement
▪ south korea and japan have signed an important trade agreement.
trade deficitwhen a country buys more goods from another country than it sells to that country
▪ the trade deficit with china remains high.
trade embargowhen a country refuses to buy goods from another country or sell goods to that country
▪ the u.s. has maintained a trade embargo against cuba since 1962.
balance of tradethe difference between the amount a country buys and the amount it sells
▪ strong exports of services helped the overall balance of trade.
world/international/overseas trade
▪ after agriculture, overseas trade accounts for the largest portion of the economy.
the fur/arms/diamond etc tradethe buying and selling of fur, weapons etc
▪ the war has created favorable conditions for the illegal arms trade.
tradenounbuying and selling buôn bán, kinh doanh, trao đổi mậu dịch; đổi chác
[ u ] the activity of buying and selling, or exchanging, goods and/or services between people or countries
_the country's tradeinmanufactured goods has expanded in the last ten years.
_seventy per cent of the country's trade iswitheurope.
_the two countries have signed a tradeagreementfor one year only.

children.name: commerce b2
children.definition: commerce/ˈkɒmɜːʳsǁˈkɑː-/  the buying and selling of goods and services, especially between companies or countries - use this to talk about these activitiesingeneral:
examples: thương mại ( nói chung giữa các công ty, quốc gia )
▪ one of the roles of the federal government is to regulate interstate commerce.
▪ he had a genuine talent for commerce and soon had a brilliant career working for the world bank.
commercenoun[ u ] buôn bán; thương mại; thương nghiệp
the activities involved in buying and selling things
_the world of commerce and industry

children.name: e-commerce x
children.definition: e-commerce/ˈiː ˌkɒmɜːʳsǁ-ˌkɑː-/  the buying and selling of goods and services on the internet:
examples: ▪ e-commerce is still a small but fast-growing part of the u.s. economy.
▪ a conference to debate the future of e-commerce
e-commercenoun[ u ] thương mại điện tử
the business of buying and selling goods and services on the internet

children.name: operations u
children.definition: operations/ˌɒpəˈreɪʃənzǁˌɑːp-/  a company’s operations are all its activities, especially in one country or one area of business:
examples: uk/us/overseas/international etc operations
▪ salco may have to close down its uk operations with the loss of 1500 jobs.
▪ he was an important decision maker in terms of gm’s overseas operations.

children.name: dealings x
children.definition: dealings/ˈdiːlɪŋz/  business activities, especially those that involve the movement of money between companies, countries, banks etc:
examples: ▪ the company had to pay a lot of tax on its financial dealings during the past tax year.
dealings with
▪ mr stockwell’s dealings with several third world banks are currently under investigation.
dealingsplural noun
activities involving other people, especially in business
_have youhadany dealingswiththeirparisoffice?

children.name: business b1
children.definition: business/ ˈbɪz.nɪs /noun(work)
examples: b1 [ u ] work that you do to earn money:
i'm in baltimore on business.
a business appointment

children.name: trade c1
children.definition: tradenounbusiness ngànhkinh doanh
examples: [ c ] a particular business or industry
_thebuilding/catering/tourist trade
_thebook/car/fur trade
_he workedinthe same trade all his life.

children.name: the public sector x
children.definition: the public sectornounkhu vực (kinh tế) nhà nước; khu vực (kinh tế) quốc doanh
examples: businesses and industries that are owned or controlled by the government
_most doctors work in the public sector.
_public sector workers such as nurses or teachers

children.name: the private sector x
children.definition: the private sector/ðə ˈpraɪvt ˌsektəʳ/  all the industries and services that are not owned or paid for by the government:
examples: khu vực tư nhân
▪ the government is now turning to the private sector for alternative ways of dealing with the country’s transportation problems.
private sector spending/housing/finance etc
chi tiêu / nhà ở / tài chính vv khu vực tư nhân
▪ private sector housing is just too expensive for low-income families in the city at the moment.
the private sectornoun[ s ]khu vực kinh tế tư nhân
businesses and industries that are not owned or controlled by the government
_thirty percent of graduates are workinginthe private sector.
_private sector employers

children.name: big business x
children.definition: big businessnounpopular
examples: something which makes a lot of money
_health clubs are big business these days.

children.name: business park x
children.definition: business parknoun khu công nghệ cao
examples: an area that is specially designed to have business offices, small factories, etc.

children.name: e-commerce
children.definition: noun thương mại điện tử
examples: the business of buying and selling goods and services on the internet

children.name: trade secret x
children.definition: trade secretnoun bí quyết công nghệ
examples: a piece of information about a product that is known only to the particular company that makes it
_the exact ingredients of coca cola are a trade secret.

children.name: market c2
children.definition: marketnounbuying and selling
examples: thị trường ( một loại sản phẩm )
the business or trade in a particular product, including financial products
_the coffee market
_the economic market
_thecommoditiesmarket
_thestockmarket
_thejobmarket
_thehousingmarket

children.name: business plan x
children.definition: business plannoun kế hoạch kinh doanh
examples: a detailed plandescribing the future plans of a business

children.name: consumer protection x
children.definition: consumer protectionnoun
examples: the protection of buyers of goods and services against low qualityor dangerous products and advertisements that deceive people

children.name: commercial x
children.definition: commercialadjectivethương mại
examples: [ before noun ]describes a product that can be bought by or is intended to be bought by the general public
